Interrupt Trigger Register type definition

Absolute Address:
Base Offset:
0x1c
Size:
0x4

Description

Single bit for each interrupt event allows SW to manually trigger occurrence of that event. Upon SW write, the bit will pulse for 1 cycle then clear to 0.

Contents

Bits Identifier Access Reset Decoded Name
[31:4] - - - -
[3] error3_trig rw, woset 0x0 -
[2] error2_trig rw, woset 0x0 -
[1] error1_trig rw, woset 0x0 -
[0] error0_trig rw, woset 0x0 -

Field Descriptions

error3_trig

Interrupt Trigger 3 bit

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.^.cptra_rst_b

error2_trig

Interrupt Trigger 2 bit

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.^.cptra_rst_b

error1_trig

Interrupt Trigger 1 bit

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.^.cptra_rst_b

error0_trig

Interrupt Trigger 0 bit

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.^.cptra_rst_b
